meanings.definition: A person or entity that sends out bills or invoices for payment.
meanings.sent1: The billers at the utility company make sure to send out invoices on time.
meanings.sent2: The small business hired a team of billers to handle their billing process.
meanings.sent3: The billers decided to have a race to see who could send out the most bills in an hour.
meanings.sent4: The billers were like diligent bees, buzzing around to collect payments.
meanings.sent5: The billers meticulously organized each invoice to avoid any errors.

meanings.definition: Plural form of the word 'biller', referring to multiple individuals or entities that send out bills or invoices for payment.
meanings.sent1: The billers in the office worked together to ensure all invoices were sent out promptly.
meanings.sent2: During tax season, the billers were especially busy handling a large volume of invoices.
meanings.sent3: The billers held a meeting to discuss strategies for improving their billing efficiency.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, billers are the unsung heroes who keep the cash flowing.
meanings.sent5: The billers collaborated seamlessly to streamline the billing process.
